0 Param data.1 string m_text: You must be Soju.
Yeah, I suppose I must be.
I'd have come to see you sooner, but I ended up taking the long way around.
Yes, I am aware. Of your near death, and of your travels Beyond.
While you were there, I was here, bedridden with fever and having the strangest dream.
I dreamt I was a child again, and that I journeyed with you in your next life.
Then are...are you Linne?
Welcome home, Soju.
I have looked forward to your return so much.
I am this city's darkness.
I can't stay here with you.
Then what will you do? Go back to the life you led before?
No.
Soju wanted—I mean, I wanted to see you.
Though not out of spite or hatred.
This realm took everything from you once, Soju.
It would be unforgivable to ask any more of you when you have nothing left to give.
But I can give you whatever it is you wish for.
So what do you want of me? Of this realm?
As both Kagachi and Soju, I have met many people, experienced countless deaths, and been touched by myriad evils.
And yet—
No—for that very reason...
What I wish for is this: for humanity's hopes and dreams to endure.
A new life for Soju.
A chance for this realm to survive.
That is what I—what we—want.
Soju...
I knew I had to come see you to make that happen, so here I am.
Because of what happened in your former life?
Yeah.
I was there when this realm was destroyed. I witnessed its end.
It was utter devastation.
I just want to know why. Why it happened, and if I can do anything to stop it. You know the answers to those questions, don't you?
The sovereign is charged with protecting the cycle of reincarnation by any means necessary.
That includes silencing the Oni.
Oni?
As I'm sure you have seen, despair sometimes builds within a person's spirit.
Anger, grief, regret, hatred. It is these emotions others cause us that give rise to that despair.
Upon death, memories and spirits are cleansed by the light before reincarnation. But despair remains.
It falls deep into the earth to escape the light.
Through prayer and other efforts, generations of sovereigns have prevented that despair from hindering reincarnation.
However...
It seems, in your previous life, there was enough despair to form the Oni.
Which can only mean one thing.
That, sometime in the future, my powers fade.
They don't just fade. You're executed. And not too long from now.
Executed?
It was already history in my former life, but I'm pretty sure this is roughly when it happens.
I figure, if I can keep you from getting killed, I can keep that world from being destroyed.
I have another suggestion.
Which is?
Find out how to cleanse the despair that has gathered in the depths of the earth.
Is that even possible?
It's never been done before.
But we cannot let the knowledge of the cause of this realm's destruction go to waste.
So...
If it's all right with you, I'll leave my life in your hands.
I'll be safe as long as you protect me, and that ought to buy the realm a little bit of time.
But if you want to ensure this world and its people remain safe long after you and I are gone—
—then reincarnation itself must be reformed.
A preemptive attack, eh?
Protecting the cycle by changing it. Should've known that the sovereign would have a different take on things.
I doubt your liegemen will like the idea of their princess joining forces with a murderer.
Then kidnap me.
You said that a little too quickly. Are you really the sovereign?
I am also your sister, lest you forget.
Can't argue there.
So where am I kidnapping you to?
The First Pillar.
Only the sovereign can access it. We should be able to learn more about the origins of this realm there.
Are you all right?
I'm sorry. I think I'd better rest, just for a little while.
No apologies necessary.
But can't you do anything about—you know, all of this?
These clothes are woven with fibers from special plants found Beyond the Veil.
They strengthen my prayers, so it would be remiss of me to change out of them.
Oh.
They suit you.
They're not exactly made for travel.
They suit you.
Do they?
Suddenly I feel very self-conscious, now that you've said that.
They're not exactly made for travel.
Indeed not.
Hey...
Yes?
Do you remember?
Remember what?
The last time we saw each other. In the Eternal Garden.
When we were children?
Yes. I remember.
I think of it every day.
You do?
Not a day has passed that you haven't crossed my mind.
Even after they told me you were dead, I always felt like...like you were alive. Somewhere out there.
But it wasn't just wishful thinking.
When I had that dream, I knew that I was right.
You mean when you dreamed about being Linne?
Yes.
She must have been a manifestation of my desire to save you. To see you become whole.
Yeah, I got that feeling too.
It all started in that dream.
I wanted to say something, anything—but no words would come. It was awful.
Perhaps that is why my nightmare stretched on, and caused those around me so much panic.
Maybe.
But what matters is that you found me.
And for that, I am thankful.
Me too.
Now then.
Ready to get going again?
Yes.
Are you all right? Can you move?
I'm fine.
Then go hide over there.
I didn't realize they were that close. Sorry.
No, I'm the one who should apologize.
Let's try and get some rest.
When they told me you had died, I...
I can't tell you how bitter I was about our separation.
But then I found out you were alive, and I felt responsible for all of your suffering.
And now you're here...right here beside me. Nothing has ever brought me such joy.
I missed you so much...
This whole time...
I'm sorry.
I'm so sorry...
I missed you, Soju.
You missed me so much you became Linne just to save Soju...to save me.
I finally understand now.
I was jealous of Linne.
Because she's you.
You know...
No... Never mind.
If you have something you want to say, say it.
Well... I—
The name you gave me...
It's a little, well—
What name?
Oh. Right.
Should I call you Sara?
Should I call you Linne?
Should I call you Sara?
Should I call you Linne?
Well, actually...
No, I don't think so.
Sara it is then.
You can walk?
Then let's get going.
So this is the place?
Perhaps. It's my first time here, too.
What's this?
There was something just like that at the palace!
You're right. It looks the same.
Maybe you can open it.
It opened! Did you see that, Soju?
Yep, I saw it. With my own two eyes, even.
This is where we'll find the origins of the realm?
If what I've heard is true, yes.
Then there must be something here that can help us. Let's have a look around.
What is this?
It looks like it's meant to be a battle, but not between humans.
Look at the size of it...
Looks like the battle is over.
This must be the continuation of the mural in the other room.
Are these the survivors?
What does this building look like to you?
Ehir Palace! It must be! Then...does that mean this is our realm?
And the survivors of the battle fled...here?
What in the Veil is this supposed to be?
The cycle of reincarnation...
These are souls, heading for the light of the next life. And that—that's the despair they've cast off, falling to the depths of the earth.
And that's the sovereign praying to lay it to rest.
But there's something before that. It looks like the despair is going somewhere. What is this?
Are these...chains?
And there's that creature again.
I don't understand.
I thought the battle was over?
But...
This mural depicts the origins of our realm.
I think you're right.
So this IS a depiction of the cycle of reincarnation.
It even shows the creation of despair, and where it gathers deep beneath the earth.
So that means this entire system was in place from the beginning?
If that's true, then—
What is this?
Could...could it be what's beyond the door?
The door beneath the palace...
Is that really where all the despair goes?
I owe you a great debt, Lady Sara. Things have proceeded more smoothly than anticipated thanks to you.
What are you talking about?
How you used that man to sow fear throughout the realm.
How you sought absolute power by killing any and all who would not obey.
Having the Night Devil for a brother has its merits.
What schemes bring you here now?
What I did, I did for no one else. It has nothing to do with Sara! We're not scheming anything!
Well, whatever the reason, it won't matter in the long run.
Why are you doing this!?
Simple, really: to ensure my family rises to prominence.
We are capable of doing everything you can do.
Of that you can be sure.
NO!
Without Sara, this world will be destroyed!
Don't be ridiculous, my mother and I would never let that happen.
You don't know what you're talking about!
You have no idea what calamity awaits this realm! If Sara dies, so does the kingdom!
I've seen it happen! I've seen how it ends!
I'm sure you have. You can tell me all about it later when I visit you in the dungeons.
If you don't get yourself killed trying to resist capture first.
I can't let you do this.
Predictable.
These Fallen have been selectively bred.
Perhaps it's a bit too early to use them for live combat, but let's experiment anyway.
Stay back, Sara.
It seems there is room for improvement.
Sara!
Now that I've captured you two traitors, we can return to the capital.
I heard she ate their souls.
They say Lady Sara was the one pulling the Executioner's strings.
The rebels were right!
No! You have to trust Sara! This realm is going to be destroyed!
Why!? Why won't you listen!?
